ChoiceDataElement.Label: Diffusion-Weighted Imaging 1

Choice.Label: 1 - No Abnormality (i.e.Normal) of ADC and high b-value DWI
Choice.ReportText: No abnormality (i.e., normal) on ADC and high b-value DWI 1/5

Choice.Label: 2 - Linear/wedge shaped hypointense on ADC and/or linear/wedge shaped hyperintense on high b-value DWI
Choice.ReportText: Linear/wedge shaped hypointense on ADC and/or linear/wedge shaped hyperintense on high b-value DWI 2/5

Choice.Label: 3 - Focal (discrete and different from the background) hypointense on ADC and/or focal hyperintense on high b-value DWI; may be markedly hypointense on ADC or markedly hyperintense on high b-value DWI, but not both
Choice.ReportText: Focal (discrete and different from the background) hypointense on ADC and/or focal hyperintense on high b-value DWI; may be markedly hypointense on ADC or markedly hyperintense on high b-value DWI, but not both 3/5

Choice.Label: 4 - Focal markedly hypontense on ADC and markedly hyperintense on high b-value DWI; <1.5cm in greatest dimension
Choice.ReportText: Focal markedly hypontense on ADC and markedly hyperintense on high b-value DWI; <1.5cm in greatest dimension 4/5

Choice.Label: 5 - Focal markedly hypontense on ADC and markedly hyperintense on high b-value DWI; >1.5cm in greatest dimension or definite extraprostatic extension/invasive behavior
Choice.ReportText: Focal markedly hypontense on ADC and markedly hyperintense on high b-value DWI; >1.5cm in greatest dimension or definite extraprostatic extension/invasive behavior 5/5

ChoiceDataElement.Label: T2 Weighted Pulse Sequences for Peripheral Zone 1

Choice.Label: 2 - Linear or wedge-shaped hypointensity or diffuse mild hypointensity, usually indistinct margin
Choice.ReportText: Linear or wedge-shaped hypointensity or diffuse mild hypointensity, usually indistinct margin 2/5

Choice.Label: 3 - Heterogeneous signal intensity or non-circumscribed, rounded, moderate hypointensity. Includes other that do not qualify as 2, 4, or 5
Choice.ReportText: Heterogeneous signal intensity or non-circumscribed, rounded, moderate hypointensity 3/5

Choice.Label: 4 - Circumscribed, homogeneous moderate hypointense focus/mass confined to prostate and < 1.5cm in greatest dimension
Choice.ReportText: Circumscribed, homogeneous moderate hypointense focus/mass confined to prostate and < 1.5cm in greatest dimension 4/5

Choice.Label: 5 - Circumscribed, homogeneous moderate hypointense focus/mass confined to prostate and > = 1.5cm in greatest dimension or definite extra prostatic extension/invasive behavior
Choice.ReportText: Circumscribed, homogeneous moderate hypointense focus/mass confined to prostate and > = 1.5cm in greatest dimension or definite extra prostatic extension/invasive behavior 5/5

ChoiceDataElement.Label: T2 Weighted Pulse Sequences for Transition Zone 1

Choice.Label: 1 - Normal appearing TZ (rare) or a round, completely encapsulated nodule ("typical nodule")
Choice.ReportText: Normal appearing TZ (rare) or a round, completely encapsulated nodule ("typical nodule") 1/5

Choice.Label: 2 - Mostly encapsulated nodule or a homogeneous circumscribed nodule without encapsulation ("atypical nodule") or a homogeneous mildly hypointense area between nodules
Choice.ReportText: Mostly encapsulated nodule or a homogeneous circumscribed nodule without encapsulation ("atypical nodule") or a homogeneous mildly hypointense area between nodules 2/5

Choice.Label: 3 - Heterogeneous signal intensity with obscured margins. Includes others that do not qualify as 2,4, or 5
Choice.ReportText: Heterogeneous signal intensity with obscured margins 3/5

Choice.Label: 4 - Lenticular or non-circumscribed, homogeneous, moderately hypointense, and < 1.5cm in greatest dimension
Choice.ReportText: Lenticular or non-circumscribed, homogeneous, moderately hypointense, and < 1.5cm in greatest dimension 4/5

Choice.Label: 5 - Lenticular or non-circumscribed, homogeneous, moderately hypointense, and > = 1.5cm in greatest dimension or definite extra prostatic extension/invasive behavior
Choice.ReportText: Lenticular or non-circumscribed, homogeneous, moderately hypointense, and > = 1.5cm in greatest dimension or definite extra prostatic extension/invasive behavior 5/5

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Dynamic Contrast Enhanced MRI 1

Choice.Label: 1 - No early or contemporaneous enhancement; or diffuse multifocal enhancement not corresponding to a focal finding on T2W and/or DWI or focal enhancement corresponding to a lesion demonstrating features of BPH on T2WI (including features of extruded BPH in the PZ)
Choice.ReportText: No early or contemporaneous enhancement; or diffuse multifocal enhancement not corresponding to a focal finding on T2W and/or DWI or focal enhancement corresponding to a lesion demonstrating features of BPH on T2WI (including features of extruded BPH in the PZ), negative

Choice.Label: 2 - Focal, and, earlier than or contemporaneously with enhancement of adjacent normal prostatic tissues, and; corresponds to suspicious finding on T2W and/or DWI
Choice.ReportText: Focal, and, earlier than or contemporaneously with enhancement of adjacent normal prostatic tissues, and; corresponds to suspicious finding on T2W and/or DWI, positive

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Patient group

Choice.Label: Men with negative findings at prior systematic transrectal US-guided biopsy at persistent risk
Men at persistent risk with negative findings or nonexplanatory histology at MRDB without systematic biopsy cores

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Include all PI-RADS categories in impression

Branch.ReportText: Staging descriptors: does not abut the "capsule" of the prostate
Staging descriptors: does not abut the "capsule" of the prostate
Staging descriptors: does not abut the "capsule" of the prostate
Staging descriptors: does not abut the "capsule" of the prostate
Overall PI-RADS category 1 (Clinically significant cancer is highly unlikely)
Overall PI-RADS category 2 (Clinically significant cancer is unlikely)
Overall PI-RADS category 3 (Clinically significant cancer is equivocal)
Overall PI-RADS category 4 (Clinically significant cancer is likely)
Overall PI-RADS category 5 (Clinically significant cancer is highly likely)
Management based on overall clinical assessment
Transrectal US biopsy if patient is at high risk
Option: If patient is not at high risk, no immediate biopsy - safety net monitoring
MRDB biopsy with or without transrectal US biopsy
Option: No biopsy in carefully chosen patients if they are not at high risk - safety net monitoring
MRDB targeting and transrectal US biopsy
If patient is not at high risk, no immediate biopsy - safety net monitoring
Option: Whole-prostate mapping biopsies if patient is at high risk or as part of clinical trial
MRDB alone, MRDB targeting and transrectal US biopsy
MRDB alone, MRDB targeting and transrectal US biopsy
Option: MRDB focal saturation, MRDB targeting and mapping biopsies
Transrectal US, saturation, or TPMB biopsies according to local rules
Option: No biopsy, safety net monitoring
Transrectal US biopsy with or without MRDB
Multiple options, including MRDB focal saturation and MRDB focal saturation with or without systematic transrectal US biopsies, and MRDB-focal saturation + whole prostate mapping
PI-RADS 1 – Very low (clinically significant cancer is highly unlikely to be present)
PI-RADS 2 – Low (clinically significant cancer is unlikely to be present)
PI-RADS 3 – Intermediate (the presence of clinically significant cancer is equivocal)
PI-RADS 4 – High (clinically significant cancer is likely to be present)
PI-RADS 5 – Very high (clinically significant cancer is highly likely to be present)
